channel.title: Creativebug - Latest Classes
channel.description: Creativebug offers online video arts and crafts workshops and techniques. Learn how to paint, knit, crochet, sew, screen print, and more.

item.title: DIY Cleaning and Craft Organization: 1/24/17
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description:
DIY Cleaning and Craft Organization 1/24/17
The sun is out and Courtney and Liana are ready to clean and tidy your craft space. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on January 24, 2017.

item.title: Carved Eraser Stamps: 1/17/17
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Courtney demonstrates how to transfer an image onto an eraser and then carve it to make a stamp. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on January 17, 2017.

item.title: How to Make Bias Tape
item.author: Ashley Nickels
item.description: An essential part of any quilter or sewist’s arsenal, bias tape is helpful for creating stretchy, durable edges. Ashley Nickels demonstrates how to find the bias on ordinary quilting cotton, then how to cut, iron, and pin fabric to an edge. This snack-sized lesson packs lots of information into just five minutes.

item.title: Single Block Projects: Quilt Block Pillow
item.author: Ashley Nickels
item.description: Wondering what to do with all of the gorgeous blocks in our Block of the Month series? Ashley Nickels shows how to expertly set any quilt block in a posh pillowcase, featuring sashing to frame the block and a hidden zipper. She demonstrates the technique using Carolyn Friedlander's Polk Block, but you can use any block you please to create custom pillows for your home.

item.title: Top 20 Classes of 2016
item.author: CBTV
item.description: Thanks to our incredible instructors for sharing their knowledge and talent with us, and thank YOU – our students – for showing up to learn. Watch this quick video to see which classes were viewed the most in 2016. To watch the full classes, click here.

item.title: Sew a Hand Warmer: 1/12/17
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Faith uses felted sweaters and needle felting to make hand warmer cozies. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on January 12, 2017.

item.title: Customized Play Tent: 1/10/2017
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Courtney demonstrates how to make a fold-up A-Frame play tent using customized fabric from Jo-Ann Fabric and Craft Stores! This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on January 10, 2017.

item.title: Bullet Journaling Ideas: 1/5/17
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Courtney and Michaela from Sakura Pens demonstrate ways to decorate your DIY planner (or any planner) with fun pens and bullet journal layouts. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on January 5, 2017.

item.title: Oil Pastel Exploration: 1/3/17
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Courtney demystifies working with oil pastels and teaches some cool techniques along the way. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on January 3, 2017.

item.title: DIY Year Planner
item.author: Faith Hale
item.description: We all know a planner is a very personal thing – it will go with you everywhere for the next year, and it has to work for you. Why not learn how to make a customizable text block planner completely from scratch? Pro bookbinder, Faith Hale, makes it super easy, showing you every step of how to combine blank sheets, printable graph paper, calendar pages, or bullet-style pages for a layout that makes your day-to-day easier to organize. You’ll learn how to make a hardback case using chipboard and book cloth, and you’ll also pick up some foundational bookbinding terms and techniques along the way.

item.title: Sewing Drawstring Bags
item.author: Ashley Nickels
item.description: Drawstring bags are a charming way to present a gift, and they couldn't be easier to make. Ashley Nickels adds a twist to this beginner sewing project by showing you how to finish the inside with French seams, and instead of twine or rope, she shows how to use selvedge trim to create your own drawstring. This customizable bag can be sewn in any size desired.

item.title: Goodbye 2016, Hello 2017!
item.author: CBTV
item.description: It's been quite a year at Creativebug. Not only did we launch CBTV and start doing twice-weekly live shoots on Facebook, but we also dove head-long into daily challenges, bringing you education and entertainment (nearly) every day of the year. Thank you for being with us on this journey! Take a look back at our 2016 milestones, and get a sneak peek at what’s coming up for 2017. It's going to be a GREAT year.

item.title: Creative Napkin Folding: 12/22/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Learn fancy ways to fold cloth napkins with Courtney and Julie.This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on December 22, 2016.

item.title: Holiday Card Display: 12/20/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Learn how to make a super cute card display using paint stirrers from the hardware store and hot glue. Genius! This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on December 20, 2016.

item.title: Creative Boot Camp - Six Exercises to Spark Artistic Discovery
item.author: Lisa Congdon
item.description:
Jumpstart your artistic practice with six weeks of creativity exercises taught by Lisa Congdon. Using a variety of Lisa's favorite art supplies and tried-and-true processes, learn how to use Microns, oil sticks, paints and collage to take a fresh look at shape, line and color. These exercises allow you to "get loose" and enjoy the process without overthinking the outcome. You’ll also learn how to work with color, use collage to respond to your in-progress artwork, and go outside to gather inspiration from your surroundings. Unlike Lisa's other classes, this series focuses less on specific projects and dives deeply into the artistic process to help you develop your own creative voice.

Make sure to share your artwork in our class galleries and on Instagram #cbugbootcamp

item.title: Q&A With Dawn DeVries Sokol: 12/15/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Join Courtney for a Q&A with Dawn DeVries Sokol as she introduces her Holiday Art Journaling class. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on December 15, 2016.

item.title: Trudy Block
item.author: Carolyn Friedlander
item.description: The Trudy Block is a truly hands-on project where you'll learn how to hand-stitch a curved applique design from start to finish. Modern quilter Carolyn Friedlander masterfully demonstrates how to do needle-turn applique, showing how to baste and sew curved applique pieces onto a background fabric. Best of all, this project is a perfect way to piece blocks on the go since you won’t need a sewing machine to make it.

item.title: Pinecone People: 12/13/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Courtney shows how to make vintage-inspired pinecone people holiday decor. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on December 13, 2016.

item.title: Creating a Mixed-Paper Sketchbook
item.author: Pam Garrison
item.description: A sketchbook featuring a range of fun and colorful papers makes the perfect background for on-the-go sketching, journaling or list making. Learn how to create a mixed-paper sketchbook by gathering together interesting papers and sewing them together with an easy pamphlet stitch. Pam Garrison also shows a few of her own mixed-paper sketchbooks, featuring solid-colored papers, patterned papers and pages on which she’s already drawn or painted.

item.title: Paper-Punched Gift Tags: 12/8/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Learn how to make painted paper-punched gift tags to spruce up any gift. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on December 8, 2016.

item.title: Stash-Busting Ornaments: 12/6/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Learn how to make two ornaments -- a faux yarn ball wreath and a felt Christmas tree -- using leftover bits from your stash. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on December 6, 2016.

item.title: Holiday Art Journaling
item.author: Dawn DeVries Sokol
item.description: Keep your creativity going strong during one of the busiest seasons of the year by making a holiday art journal. Dawn DeVries Sokol shows how to transform everyday ephemera into collage fodder for your pages, working with embellishments, images and lettering to create holiday themed pages without a fuss. Every week, Dawn provides new themes to focus on, encouraging you to take a few moments a day to sit down and celebrate the season. Be sure to share what you make in our class galleries, or on Instagram #cbdrawaday #cbugholiday #creativebug !

Be sure to share what you make in our class galleries, or on Instagram #cbdrawaday #cbugholiday #creativebug !

item.title: Crocheted Abominable Snowman
item.author: Twinkie Chan
item.description: This adorable plush toy is anything but abominable. Crochet designer Twinkie Chan shows you how to work in the round with simple stitches to build your Yeti. You will also learn how to stuff him, whipstitch him together, and finally, how to create an optional Santa hat.

item.title: Gift Tags with Sakura: 12/1/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Sakura of America shares techniques for crafting with Souffle and Glaze Pens. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on December 1, 2016.

item.title: Matchbox Advent Calendar: 11/29/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Get ready for the holidays with Courtney as she shows you how to make an advent calendar out of matchboxes. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on November 29, 2016.

item.title: Adding Duplicate Stitch to Knits
item.author: Marly Bird
item.description: Learn how to add customized monograms to your knits with the magic of duplicate stitch. Marly Bird shows you how this simple hand-sewn stitch is applied to knitted fabric, mimicking the knit stitches in order to create a seamless embellishment. Best of all, this stitch can be added to any finished knitting, so you can choose to embellish your project even after you’ve bound off. Downloadable PDF with monogram charts included with class.

item.title: Place Setting: 11/21/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Courtney shows how to design the perfect (and proper) place setting. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on November 21, 2016.

item.title: Chromatic Tablescape: 11/17/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Join Courtney as she crafts a stunning edible tablescape that is perfect for the holidays. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on November 17, 2016.

item.title: Adjusting Sewing Patterns with Simplicity
item.author: Deborah Kreiling
item.description: Deborah Kreiling specializes in teaching home sewists how commercial patterns work, and how they can be adjusted to create the best fitting garments. As the director of design development at Simplicity, Deb has been in the business of helping home sewers make and adjust beautiful garments for over 30 years. In this comprehensive course, Deb teaches the ins and outs of making a variety of pattern alterations that cover things like bust adjustments, adding or subtracting ease, lengthening hems, and adjusting darts and princess seams.

item.title: Personalized Fabric Gift Bags: 11/15/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Liana shows you how to make a no-sew gift bag using personalized fabric from JoAnn. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on November 15, 2016.

item.title: Bag Design Workshop
item.author: Nicole Mallalieu
item.description: In this three-part master course, professional bag designer Nicole Mallalieu expertly guides you through the bag design process from concept to construction. Learn how to break three-dimensional bag shapes down into two-dimensional shapes, play with construction lines and seam allowances, and then figure out how your bag design will fit together. Sound hard? It’s not as scary as you might think! And since we’re mocking everything up in muslin, the pressure is off until you get your bag design just right.

item.title: Bag Design Workshop
item.author: Nicole Mallalieu
item.description: In this three-part master course, professional bag designer Nicole Mallalieu expertly guides you through the bag design process from concept to construction. Learn how to break three-dimensional bag shapes down into two-dimensional shapes, play with construction lines and seam allowances, and then figure out how your bag design will fit together. Sound hard? It’s not as scary as you might think! And since we’re mocking everything up in muslin, the pressure is off until you get your bag design just right.
